clinical_study.brief_title: Unilateral vs. Bilateral Approaches to Hybrid Stroke Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: Unilateral vs. Bilateral Approaches to Hybrid Stroke Rehabilitation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the project is to compare the effects of unilateral hybrid therapy [unilateral robot-assisted therapy (RT)] + unilateral arm training (UAT)] and bilateral hybrid therapy [bilateral RT + bilateral arm training (BAT)] on motor function, daily function, mobility, life quality, and motor control strategy in stroke patients.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive 6 weeks of bilateral RT training using the BMT and UAT training in each session.
Participants will receive 6 weeks of bilateral RT training using the BMT and BAT training in each session.
Participants will receive 6 weeks of RT training using the BMT in each session.

intervention.description: For the unilateral RT training, participants will practice with their affected arms following a unilateral training protocol of BMT for 45 minutes (Yang, et al., 2012). For the UAT training, participants will receive training of the affected UL in functional tasks with behavioral shaping for 45 minutes (Lin, Wu, et al., 2009).

For the bilateral RT training, patients will focus on training involving both arms using the BMT robot for 45 minutes. During the 45 minutes BAT training, participants will receive training in tasks focusing on bilateral symmetric or alternating movements of both ULs.
